page.title: 07Public Pressure:open spaces.
page.content: Unrestricted public access to woods and other open spaces which are all so close to urban areas creates many conflicts with conservation measures. Wildlife disturbance is not excessive in Belfairs Nature Reserve itself because it is fenced, but it is a severe problem in other woods. Uncontrolled dogs, children, motor cyclists, BMX riders and air gunners are a constant problem. Fires, damage to equipment, glue sniffing and rubbish dumping are common. Farmers report similar problems, particularly those whose land is easily visible from roads. One local farmer reports pressure too from both{ local organisations who want to stage events on his land and from local residents who object.
